Namespace Terra.CoherentNoise.Generation.Modification

Classes

Bias

Bias generator is used to "shift" mean value of source settings. Source is assumed to have values between -1 and 1; after Bias is applied, the result is still between -1 and 1, but the points that were equal to 0 are shifted by bias value.

Binarize

This generator binarizes its source settings, returning only value 0 and 1. A constant treshold value is user for binarization. I.e. result will be 0 where source value is less than treshold, and 1 elsewhere.

Curve

This generator modifies source settings by applying a curve transorm to it. Curves can be edited using Unity editor's CurveFields, or created procedurally.

Gain

This generator is used to "sharpen" settings, shifting extreme values closer to -1 and 1, while leaving 0 in place. Source settings is clamped to [-1,1], as values outside of this range may result in division by 0. Resulting settings is between -1 and 1, with values that were equal to 0.5 shifted to 0.5+gain/2, and those that were equal to -0.5 shifted to -0.5-gain/2.

Modify

This generator takes a source generator and applies a function to its output.
